result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Travis Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Travis Berry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Travis Berry was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard Travis Berry in court pro se, in custody.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for reinstatement of Huber. ADA Burdon stated ADA Long objected. Huber reinstated on March 10, 2017.  Good time motion denied.
Hearing on February 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
for Huber be reinstatement

Defendant Richard Travis Berry by video, in custody.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wrote to court requesting Huber reinstated.  State objected with argument.  Court denied the motion.
Motion hearing on December 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant requests good time or Huber be reinstated.
